Identify the properties of prime numbers and list all primes greater than 3.
Recognize that \( p^2 - q^2 \) can be rewritten and factorized into \( (p-q)(p+q) \).
Determine all possible products of \( (p-q)(p+q) \) by considering distinct prime pairs.
Understand how to calculate modulo operations, specifically how to find \( p^2 - q^2 \mod 24 \).
Evaluate \( (p-q)(p+q) \) modulo 24 for various pairs of primes \( p \) and \( q \).
Identify any patterns or rules in the modulo results to simplify further calculations.
Compile all possible values of \( p^2 - q^2 \mod 24 \) based on the evaluated results for different prime combinations.
Verify results by testing specific cases and checking if all combinations have been considered.

Identify the properties of prime numbers greater than 3 concerning their modulo 24 representation.
Determine all possible values of p mod 24 and q mod 24 for prime numbers p and q greater than 3.
Compute the expression p^2 mod 24 for each possible value of p mod 24.
Compute the expression q^2 mod 24 for each possible value of q mod 24.
List all possible combinations of p^2 mod 24 and q^2 mod 24.
Calculate the difference p^2 - q^2 for each combination from the previous step.
Take each difference computed in step 6 and determine its value modulo 24.
Identify and list all distinct values obtained in step 7 as the possible values of p^2 - q^2 mod 24.

Simplify the difference \( p^2 - q^2 \) in terms of its modulo 24 equivalence.

Recognize that if p and q are prime numbers greater than 3, they are odd and not divisible by 2 or 3.
Express p and q in a form that accounts for these properties (typically, p = 6k ± 1 and q = 6j ± 1 for integers k, j).
Write down the expression for p^2 - q^2 and expand it to (p+q)(p-q).
Consider the implications of different combinations of ±1 from the form of p and q on the product (p+q)(p-q).
Calculate the modulo 24 results of the values ±1, ±2, and ±3 for p and q due to their format related to 6k ± 1.
Examine the distributive property of modulo operations over addition and multiplication to simplify the calculation of p^2 - q^2 mod 24.
List all possible evaluations of (p+q) and (p-q) modulo 24 based on the potential ±1 combinations for p and q.
Derive the complete set of values for (p^2 - q^2) mod 24 by taking into account all possible values of (p+q) mod 24 and (p-q) mod 24.
Enumerate the combinations where q equals p, and verify if additional values or repetition occurs in p^2 - q^2 mod 24.
